item.title: Report X-2025041197
item.description:
Report X-2025041197

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5105681 at the station location in Kansas City, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered emitting a strong odor at the facility. Further investigation revealed that paint had spilled inside of its inner packaging and contained. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. All measurements mentioned in this report are estimated due to the missing information.

item.title: Report X-2025040970
item.description:
Report X-2025040970

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING AN ALCOHOL-LIKE ODOR BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND EVACUATED THE AREA. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 4-LITER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APROXIMATELY 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO A SIDEWALL OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.
